Dear Sir, Madam, 
  
 
In searching the Internet, Irdeto Access B.V. has established that the content of
the website http://www.rdi-board.com/showthread.php?t=36706
<http://www.varkoume.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=13785&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0&sid=71e1cb9814ece76d88162058cb20019e>
 <http://www.boxcracker.org/>  ("the Website") infringes its intellectual property
rights. Furthermore, the content of the Webpage is unlawful, based on amongst others
Clause 4 of the Conditional Access Directive (98/84/EC) and the corresponding
article of the EC Copyright Directive (2001/29/EC), which provides legal protection
against the illegal circumvention of technological protection measures.  
 
  
 
Description of the abuse 
The web page publishes advertisement for Card sharing software that offer illegal
access to Irdeto2 encrypted Channels through payable internet card sharing
subscriptions. 
 
 
  
 
About Irdeto Access B.V. 
For information on Irdeto Access B.V.'s conditional access technology please see
www.irdeto.com <blocked::http://www.irdeto.com/> . Please note that the conditional
access system is designed, developed, manufactured and licensed by Irdeto Access
B.V. and the system is proprietary to Irdeto Access B.V. Furthermore, please note
that Irdeto Access B.V. is an active member of AEPOC (European Association for the
Protection of Encrypted Works and Services). Please see www.aepoc.org
<blocked::http://www.aepoc.org/>  in this regard.  
 
  
 
Request to take action 
I hereby request you to take sufficient action in order to remove the Website from
the Internet. I emphasize that an ISP can be held liable for infringing information
on websites for which it is responsible. Furthermore, based on article 14 of the
European Directive on Electronic Commerce (2000/31/EC) (implemented in the
Netherlands in article 6:196C of the Dutch Civil Code) and based on the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act (article 512 US Copyright Act), an ISP is obliged to as
soon as the ISP obtains actual knowledge of illegal activity or information and is
aware of facts or circumstances from which the illegal activity or information is
apparent, to act expeditiously to remove or to disable access to the information.
Reference is made to the decision of the Court of Appeal of Amsterdam, the
Netherlands, dated 7 November 2002 (XS4ALL/Deutsche Bahn).  
Please provide me with the name and contact details of the owner of the related
Website. Reference is made to the ruling of the Dutch Supreme Court of 25 November
2005 (Lycos/Pessers), in which the Supreme Court ruled that an ISP should co-operate
with third parties in retrieving the identity of the operator of a website if the
content of Webpages on such website could be unlawful towards those third parties.  
Proof of copyright  
Irdeto Access B.V. is the rightful owner of the copyright and in the Netherlands no
registration is required for obtaining a copyright. Under the Bern Convention it is
prohibited to demand a copyright registration certificate when asked to act against
copyright infringement on the basis of a non US origined copyright. Furthermore,
under the Bern Convention, to which the US is a member, in the US any non US
originated copyright will be awarded the same level of protection as a US registered
copyright without any registration requirement. Therefore, Irdeto Access B.V. may
demand direct action against any copyright infringement without proof of its
copyright. Please note that there is no such copyright registration number or
certificate.  
 
Statement of good faith belief and authorisation 
Irdeto Access B.V. has the good faith belief that use of the infringing smart card
sharing is not authorized by the copyright owner, being Irdeto Access B.V., its
agent or the law.  
This notification is drafted observing accuracy and on the basis that Irdeto Access
B.V. is, as the owner of the relevant copyright, authorized to act against the
concerned copyright infringement. 
 
Attached you will find a Power of Attorney authorising the undersigned to act on
behalf of Irdeto Access B.V. as well as downloaded files from the infringing website
and the related WhoIs information.  
This statement is drafted under penalty of perjury that the information contained
herein is accurate. 
 
  
 
I hereby kindly request you to inform me within 3 days after the receipt of this
notice, whether or not you will act expeditiously to remove or to disable access to
the information and whether or not you will assist Irdeto Access B.V. in retrieving
the identity of the operator of the Website.
